data.title: Louis, Dauphin of France, Duke of Burgundy (1682-1712), son of the 'Grand Dauphin'
data.meta_description: Engraving by Pierre Drevet (1663-1738), after Hyacinthe Rigaud. Portrait of Louis, Dauphin of France, Duke of Burgundy (1682-1712), son of the 'Grand Dauphin'; late 17th century-early 18th century, French. Lettered with names of artist and engraver.
data.meta_site_name: Victoria and Albert Museum: Explore the Collections
data.text:
CategoryObject typeTitleLouis, Dauphin of France, Duke of Burgundy (1682-1712), son of the 'Grand Dauphin' (generic title)Materials and techniques

Engraving on paper

Brief description

Engraving by Pierre Drevet (1663-1738), after Hyacinthe Rigaud. Portrait of Louis, Dauphin of France, Duke of Burgundy (1682-1712), son of the 'Grand Dauphin'; late 17th century-early 18th century, French. Lettered with names of artist and engraver.

Physical description

Engraving by Pierre Drevet (1663-1738), after Hyacinthe Rigaud. 'Louis, Dauphin of France, Duke of Burgundy (1682-1712), son of the "Grand Dauphin"'; late 17th century-early 18th century, French. Portrait, half-length, facing half right, within an oval border with letters. Lettered 'H. Rigaud pinx. P. Drevet Sculp.'

Dimensions

Height: 47cm

Width: 38.8cm

Taken from 'Victoria and Albert Museum Department of Prints and Drawings and Department of Paintings Accessions 1965' published by HMSO 1966Marks and inscriptions

'H. Rigaud pinx. P. Drevet Sculp.' (Lettered)

Credit line

Given by Mrs E. Fuller in memory of the Reverend A. Fuller and A.W.F. Fuller through Art Fund

Object history

F-D.57, BN:Fonds 25. Both 2nd state

Subjects depictedAssociated objectsBibliographic reference

Victoria and Albert Museum Department of Prints and Drawings and Department of Paintings Accessions 1965 pub. HMSO 1966

Collection
